definition: water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Yes, they got divorced, for his wife was unstable as water.
sentences.chinese: 是的，他们离婚了，因为他的妻子水性杨花。

sentences.english: He has been uneasy with this woman's skittish.
sentences.chinese: 他一直都介意这个女人的水性杨花。

sentences.english: You are a lady of easy virtue.
sentences.chinese: 你是个水性杨花的女人。

sentences.english: The history, as we know, it is both of easy virtue and ruthlessness.
sentences.chinese: 历史，我们知道，它水性杨花又冷酷无情。

sentences.english: She says the programme portrayed her as a "lady of easy virtue ".
sentences.chinese: 她说这个节目把她刻画成了一个“水性杨花的女人”。

sentences.english: Scene of debauchery achievement man of ambition, wanton make significant woman style.
sentences.chinese: 灯红酒绿成就男人雄心，水性杨花显尽女人风情。

sentences.english: She should be a skittish woman.
sentences.chinese: 她应该是一个水性杨花的女人。

definition: fickle (in love affairs)/dissipated/unfaithful/heart of a flower (pistil and stamen)
to change at once on seeing sth different (idiom); loving fads and novelty/never satisfied with what one has
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
lit. the red apricot tree leans over the garden wall (idiom)/fig. a wife having an illicit lover
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
lit. say three in the morning but four in the evening (idiom); to change sth that is already settled upon/indecisive/to blow hot and cold
